intro: Mapania nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed mapania, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in Brazil and Peru. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
